thread.title: United Sports Associates Joins Forces with Leverage Agency on Historic "Cricket All-Stars" Series

author: cbs8
title: United Sports Associates Joins Forces with Leverage Agency on Historic "Cricket All-Stars" Series
text:
Information contained on this page is provided by an independent third-party content provider. WorldNow and this Station make no warranties or representations in connection therewith. If you have any questions or comments about this page please contact pressreleases@worldnow.com .
SOURCE Leverage Agency, LLC
-- Joint Venture to Bring Legendary Cricket Players to America to Play in Major League Baseball Stadiums --
NEW YORK , Oct. 22, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Leverage Agency CEO Ben Sturner announced today that United Sports Associates, an Australian-based global sports and talent management company, has come on-board as a partner for the inaugural "Cricket All-Stars" tour. Headlined by global cricket icons Sachin Tendulkar and Shane Warne , the "Cricket All-Stars" is a three-game series in New York City , Houston and Los Angeles featuring a stellar lineup of renowned cricket players from around the world.
United Sports Associates specializes in event production, hospitality, talent management, licensing and media production. As part of the partnership, United Sports Associates will spearhead the production of several initiatives during the "Cricket All-Stars" tour including VIP parties, galas and special functions with the players. They will also work seamlessly with Leverage Agency to produce the cricket matches, promote the tour and facilitate player engagement.
"I met Ben Sturner last year in India during the initial discussions with Sachin Tendulkar about creating the Cricket All-Stars tour," said Raj Ramakrishan, Managing Director of United Sports Associates. "We've been working closely with Leverage ever since, and it's great to create this joint partnership to bring these incredible cricket players to America for the first time."
"Raj has been an integral member of the Cricket All-Stars management team since the beginning and I'm thrilled to bring our partnership to the next level," said Ben Sturner , CEO of Leverage Agency. "It's been a dream of mine to bring world-class cricket to America and we're very close now with the matches only weeks away. I think the fans will really enjoy the fast-paced T20 format and high-octane atmosphere in the baseball stadiums."
The "Cricket All-Stars" kicks off on November 7 at Citi Field in New York City. The second match will be on November 11 at Minute Maid Park in Houston. The final match in the series will be on November 14 at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles. The format will be T20, a much shorter and boisterous form of cricket with the games taking around three hours. Sponsors for "Cricket All-Stars" include MasterCard, State Farm®, Uber and Pepsi.
United Sports Associates: www.cricketandbeyond.com
Leverage Agency: www.leverageagency.com
Purchase Tickets: www.CricketAllStars2015.com or www.Facebook.com/cricketallstars
